title: Nerf Tryndamere Nerf Wukong Nerf Cho'Gath
body:
Wu needs less ms on his ult now that black cleaver has phage attached. Tryndamere is just a bs champ. Removes 80 ad from champs. Wow I didnt even know he did this. Also, Undying Rage is complete bs. Rework Him.

Cho'Gath just needs that silence nerfed.

replies.body: I have a better idea why not just become a better player?

> [{quoted}](name=Darkmind1212,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mEzIeXEs,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-06-15T20:50:16.182+0000)
>
> I have a better idea why not just become a better player?

an interesting comment from the guy who lost his last 12 ranked games. 

EDIT FOR CLAIRIFICATION: (I mean to say that this person could be a troll. Loosing 12 consecutive ranked games is indicative of this. Though not conclusive)

> [{quoted}](name=MightySaturn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mEzIeXEs,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-06-16T16:32:07.320+0000)
>
> an interesting comment from the guy who lost his last 12 ranked games.

An interesting response that has nothing to do with the subject at hand.

Did he say he was good? No.
Are you good? Probably not by this post.
The difference? He isn't whining and blaming his suckyness on champion balance.

> [{quoted}](name=Coriandr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mEzIeXEs,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-06-16T16:36:30.753+0000)
>
> An interesting response that has nothing to do with the subject at hand.
> 
> Did he say he was good? No.
> Are you good? Probably not by this post.
> The difference? He isn't whining and blaming his suckyness on champion balance.

What does my opinion on champion balance have to do with my desire to improve? 

"Are you good? Probably not by this post.
The difference? He isn't whining and blaming his suckyness on champion balance"

^^A conclusion jumped to based on three or four lines of text written on the internet.  It has little value and is overly personal. I will remember to report you. 

Cho'Gath is a champion used for elo boosting. What criterion would someone use to select a champion for this purpose? Because he is "freelo".

My opinion of cho'gath is due to this and is shared at large.

My opinion of WuKong is due to opinions of friends.

My opinion of Tryndamere is shared by some riot employees and is in line with balance philosophies of riot. Tryndamere has hidden power. I only just found out secondary effects of his w. ( I think it is w that reduces 80 AD in an aoe)

As for the relative relevance of our posts...yours is pretty off topic too. You dont really express any opinions of the champion. Instead you express personal opinions of people on the forum.

> [{quoted}](name=MightySaturn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mEzIeXEs,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-06-16T16:32:07.320+0000)
>
> an interesting comment from the guy who lost his last 12 ranked games. 
> 
> EDIT FOR CLAIRIFICATION: (I mean to say that this person could be a troll. Loosing 12 consecutive ranked games is indicative of this. Though not conclusive)

call the 12 losses a mixture of being outplayed and just a horrible luck of the draw in terms of attitudes you have to contend with. But you can't win them all so I'm not to bothered by this.

> [{quoted}](name=Darkmind1212,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mEzIeXEs,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-06-15T20:50:16.182+0000)
>
> I have a better idea why not just become a better player?

I should explain this a little better, my bad my bad. What I mean is acquire more knowledge before screaming nerf. You might have missed ways you didn't know about on how to beat them.

{{champion:62}} Is fine 
{{champion:23}} Is annoying not OP 
{{champion:31}} fair enough I say reduce silence duration and he's fine.

> [{quoted}](name=stealthfox94,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mEzIeXEs,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-06-16T17:09:15.749+0000)
>
> {{champion:62}} Is fine 
> {{champion:23}} Is annoying not OP 
> {{champion:31}} fair enough I say reduce silence duration and he's fine.

The irony is that, despite Wukong being complained about the least often of the three, he's probably the strongest one.

A Tryndamere that's behind is a minor nuisance. Same with Cho.

Wukong's ult is so strong that it can single-handedly win team fights and put him back into the game.

> [{quoted}](name=NemeBro,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mEzIeXEs,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2015-06-21T07:15:56.166+0000)
>
> The irony is that, despite Wukong being complained about the least often of the three, he's probably the strongest one.
> 
> A Tryndamere that's behind is a minor nuisance. Same with Cho.
> 
> Wukong's ult is so strong that it can single-handedly win team fights and put him back into the game.

Thank you for fair treatment of my post! I dont understand the attitudes! I meant this to be a thread about champions who are never talked about on the forums as needing nerfs, but who clearly deserve one or two nerfs. I think tryn is probably the least deserving of a nerf.

Yes, His ult can do what you just said. Although, i think some of his winrate is inflated due to his synergy with yasuo, he seems to be a little too easy and stronk.

> [{quoted}](name=stealthfox94,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mEzIeXEs,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-06-16T17:09:15.749+0000)
>
> {{champion:62}} Is fine 
> {{champion:23}} Is annoying not OP 
> {{champion:31}} fair enough I say reduce silence duration and he's fine.

I think WuKong needs a ms nerf on his ulti now that black cleaver grants phage
in a game state where Ekko is a champion....you are whining about tryndamere and wukong?
